climbs.name: Witch Ever Won Seams Write Too Yew

content.description: A mix of trad and 3 bolts
content.protection: gear to 3", 2 bolts, belay at top, walk off or rap.
content.location: Start same as Discursive Somnambulism to 1st bolt, then cut right, and follow crack on the right side of column .

climbs.name: Mortal Prying in the V-Shaped Realm

content.description: Climb in cut holds, make a couple of clips under the roof, then crank the strenuous bulge.  The rest of the climb is stemming and face climbing up to the chains.
content.location: 4th climb from the left on the Riverview Columns sport climbing wall.  Look for the bulging one!

climbs.name: The Inverted Trance of a Rapturous Nocternity

content.description:
Climbs wavy arete right of "Mortal Prying...".

The books strongly suggests belaying this one from the top avoid "rope scrapage".  Also, rap rather than lower.
content.location: 5th climb from the left on Riverview Columns sport climbing wall.

content.description:
A bit dirty, doesn't seem like its had much traffic. Watch out for loose stuff, particularly on the right.

Start up the right crack and transition to the left crack about 3/4 up past the wavy bulge. Good pro throughout.

Shares anchor with Inverted Trance, a couple of long chains on a nice broken pillar ledge. Can be difficult to clean as the angle of the descent pulls you left. Might be best to bring up your belayer and both rap down.
content.location: Right of Inverted Trance. Scramble up to the base of the column to start.

content.description: Ascend the pillar face.  The most "vantage-like" of the climbs at Riverview Columns.
content.location: The very last climb you come to on the Sunshine Wall, look for the pillar.  Left-most of the 5 climbs at Riverview Columns.

content.description: Pretty fun route, with a mix of bolts and trad gear.
content.protection: 4  bolts, small finger size cams to .5, anchor is far back, belay 2nd up or use cordellet, walk off 3rd Gully or rap.
content.location: Right side of Riverview Columns alcove, facing more south then the left side which faces more east. A scramble up loose scree, the bolts are visible, this is the left of two routes.

climbs.name: Crepuscular Passions of the Blissfully Spanked

content.description: Climb past a difficult finger crack crux move into nice moderate face climbing and stemming above.  My favorite climb in the area.
content.protection: 4 bolts, chain anchors.  Optional #1 Camelot for middle section.
content.location: 3rd from left sport climb on the Riverview Columns sport climbing wall.

content.description: Climb between pillars, working cracks.  In the book it mentions an optional #1 Camelot, though we didn't think this was necessary.
content.location: Located 2nd from left on the Riverview Columns sport climbing cliff.
